info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 9 at 4:12PM EDT until June 9 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington OH
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...The following county, in south central Ohio, Scioto.
* WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 412 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in Minor flooding has been reported in western Scioto County. . Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Portsmouth, Wheelersburg, New Boston, Rosemount, Lucasville, Clarktown, Sciotodale, Otway, Mcdermott, West Portsmouth, Lombardsville, Bear Creek, Friendship, Turkey Creek Lake, Minford, Portsmouth Regional Airport, State Route 335 at State Route 776 and Buena Vista in Scioto County.
info.instruction:
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
